name: Viral Genetics
overview: Viral Genetics, Inc. engages in the research and development of protein-based therapeutic and diagnostic products with applications in infectious disease, autoimmune conditions, and immunological deficiency. The company discovers, develops, and commercializes a series of proprietary proteins based primarily on Thymus Nuclear Protein (TNP). TNP is a processed extract of mammalian thymus tissue. The company owns 100% of a Chinese subsidiary called Viral Genetics Beijing, Ltd. VGV-1 VGV-1 is a suspension of TNP in alum adjuvant. It is the companyâ€™s lead drug candidate and is a prospective treatment for HIV infection and AIDS. VGV-1 is in the preclinical stage of development in the USA. History Viral Genetics, Inc. was founded in 1995.

acquisitions.source_description: Viral Genetics, Inc. Completes Acquisition of V-Clip Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
